name: Swagat Subhakanta Das
position: Growth Analyst @Uni Cards | Ex-Groww | NIT Rourkela
about: I am passionate about consulting, analytics, problem-solving, and product management, and I seek to leverage these competencies in my current and future roles. I have also gained experience in social media marketing, graphic design, and social media outreach through my internships and extracurricular activities. I have completed my B. Tech in Chemical Engineering from NIT Rourkela, where I was involved in various academic and leadership initiatives. I aim to continue learning and growing as a data analyst and a professional.

I was also responsible for bringing in industrial partners, when necessary as well as promote the chapter on different platforms, which includes intra and inter-chapter communication and management.

volunteer_experience.info: D361 is the creative club of NIT Rourkela, with a presence on all social media platforms as well as the web. We publish the annual creative magazine of the college and also publish hundreds of content throughout the year. As the design head, I was responsible for the designing of the magazines, content layouts of all the posts and blogs, all while managing a fabulous team of designers.

volunteer_experience.info: I was the PR team head for the NITRIMUN 2020. In this conference, we had many national as well as international speakers,i.e., reputed journalists, Nobel laureates, etc. We also had some 35 media partners associated with the MUN event. It was a huge success in the MUN circuit for which we got a lot of appreciation also. In this PR team, I led a group of people who worked passionately with utmost dedication for the success of this event.

honors_and_awards.title: Winner in International ChemE Jeopardy at AIChE ASC 2021
honors_and_awards.description: AIChE ChemE Jeopardy Competition at Regional & Annual Student Conferences utilizes questions from Chemical Engineering Undergrad Coursework. ChemE Jeopardy Games are held at the Regional Conference level in the Spring. The Championship teams from each of the 9 Regional Conferences go on to compete at the Annual Student Conference in the Fall to determine the Champion school for the year.
